page.title: 03 High Gosforth Park contd.
page.content: The Northumberland Plate is run over two miles on the circular course. It is run on the last Saturday of Race Week,which is a holiday throughout the region. Racing in Newcastle started in 1621. One hundred and ten years later Thomas Smyles wrote down in his diary about a week of racing.The diary said that on June 12th he spent fifteen pounds, seventeen shillings and six pence. Most of the money was spent on drink. The people went to see racing first at Killingworth Moor,then it changed to the Town Moor and then they moved to Gosforth Park in 1881.There are 27 days racing each year.Races are run under National Hunt rules in winter and on Flat in summer.Most race meetings last three days,and there are six races each day.
